review_preview: Small, unpretentious restaurant with excellent quality Korean food at affordable prices.Meat prepared on a pan on the table is a must. Sushi-like rolls are very good, including the vegetarian ones. The place is really tiny and reservations are highly recommended. On busy days they...
review_full: Small, unpretentious restaurant with excellent quality Korean food at affordable prices. Meat prepared on a pan on the table is a must. Sushi-like rolls are very good, including the vegetarian ones.  The place is really tiny and reservations are highly recommended. On busy days they could get a little obnoxious rushing you to clear your table to accommodate a second round of guests but, in general, staff is very friendly. Shake is of good quality and served as it must: warm, not hot. Lichis are a nice dessert, if you fancy. Have not tried a dish I didn't like, but rice quality, while good, was below the rest. Dressing tip: mind that food will be cooked in your table. Your clothes will SMELL when you get out. Be prepared an wear something that could go straight to the washing machine! :-)

title_review: Really nice little restaurant with very good food, although a bit limited for vegans.

review_full: Vietnam 24 is a lovely little restaurant with really great Vietnamese food! The menu is not very vegan/vegetarian friendly, although there are dishes that can be made vegan (and are marked on the menu). The fresh spring rolls (vegetarian) are fantastic, and the main dishes are quite good. The staff is super friendly, attentive, and they remember you (and your order!) even when months have elapsed since your last trip. The pricing is somewhat high, although the food is always delicious. Would definitely recommend!

title_review: Don't be fooled by the tourists
review_preview: I must admit:  My boyfriend picked this restaurant and I did not want to eat here because I thought it was a tourist trap. I am from Spain and live in NY so to me this was the equivalent of a restaurant in Times Square....
review_full: I must admit: My boyfriend picked this restaurant and I did not want to eat here because I thought it was a tourist trap. I am from Spain and live in NY so to me this was the equivalent of a restaurant in Times Square. BOY.WAS.I.WRONG. We sat down and ordered a wine (vino de la casa) and a beer. The vino de la casa was amazing. For appetizer we had half of their amazing tomatoes with olive oil and salt - so tasty! We only ordered half since the whole tomato would probably feed 4 people. Now. The paella. OMG. The paella was so, so good. We got the paella for two and ate every last grain of rice in that paellera, just look at the before and after photos. I can't even put it into words, you'll have to go to Madrid and try it for yourself and message me your thank yous.

review_full: We were wandering the streets looking for a specific place to eat and we stumbled across Cantina La Traviesa. We were seated immediately even though the restaurant was nearly full. We had wonderful appetizers and a bottle of wine to start. We suggest the grilled vegetables. They were perfectly done. One of the three of us had a fresh green salad where they added on chicken for her. It was a great portion and very fresh. My wife and I had the steak with fries. Although we asked for medium rare, they always seem to cook the beef more in Europe. Regardless, the spicing and flavors were excellent. While eating we were slightly entertained by a roving group of musicians that wandered through the restaurant. All in all it was a very positive experience. We definitely would go back again.

Food and drink are great, but I will always give high marks when the staff takes action to engage you. As the accompanying photo demonstrates, I am not an introvert; but I encourage all who journey to this restaurant to "open up" and seek to engage the staff. Simply stated, this is a warm environment waiting for you to walk through the door and have a great time. BTW: ask the staff to serve you the same food and drink the staff provides to the Tapas tour as this is a great way to start the experience.

By this I mean we ordered...escapes me now...and the waiter said they were small and we should order two. Well when it arrived it was by no means small and we wound up with more than we wanted. He tried this on a couple of items so i really had the impression it was just about getting more out our wallets. Haven't expereinced this before in tapas restaurants in Spain before, especially since it's so easy to just order more as needed. I also didn't care for the TV's, one of which was playing Fraiser; last thing i want to see on vacation at dinner in Europe.

With a shrug he said "it's ok". Even our Spanish friend laughed when she saw the picture (the rice looks raw even in it!). If this is what they think paella is supposed to be, well other's should be aware of their "service". For 15e a person (min 2 person) it's ridiculous, even the portion size is small.

title_review: The most fun people watching at a sidewalk table, memorable dining experience!
review_preview: We were wandering the streets getting hungry and walked past this restaurant. We walked on and checked out the other places in the area and went back to what seemed the most welcoming. The waiter gave us our choice of open outside tables. The inside...
review_full: We were wandering the streets getting hungry and walked past this restaurant. We walked on and checked out the other places in the area and went back to what seemed the most welcoming. The waiter gave us our choice of open outside tables. The inside was crowded, but with a happy crowd. We were seated across from the service window and had a great show of the waiter cutting thin slices of ham and making ham and. Cheese plates. We started with two big mugs (jarras) of beer and were brought a plate of Parmesan, ham and crackers. A tasty start. The menu is packed with delicious choices. We ordered a plate of pimientos de Padron. Fried peppers grown in Galicia, in oil and salt. Very tasty with a big roll brought to the table. We also had huevos rotos, broken eggs that were two fried eggs on a big bed of fried potatoes and covered with thinly sliced ham. You break the yolks and mix it all together to make a spectacularly delicious and filling meal. The waiters were super friendly and service excellent. We really enjoyed the mobs of people who walked by and did not feel crowded or rushed. This was one of our favorite experiences in Madrid. We were shocked when the bill came how little we owed for the amount of food and drink. We will return here again!

review_preview: We stopped here for a drink and tapas on a night-time tour of the area around the Plaza Mayor. The staff was friendly and attentive and offered us a small complementary plate of their house brands of cheese and ham. They were delicious. We ordered...
review_full: We stopped here for a drink and tapas on a night-time tour of the area around the Plaza Mayor. The staff was friendly and attentive and offered us a small complementary plate of their house brands of cheese and ham. They were delicious. We ordered a full plate of ham, which was one of the largest portions we'd ever received in Spain. It was delicious and, amazingly, we finished it all. Other diners have noted that it's not hard to get a table here. Although we didn't have any other food there, others ordered from an extensive and traditional menu. It's definitely worth trying out, particularly if you are trying tapas in the many bars and restaurants near the P. Mayor.

review_preview: Walked up and down this street  outside CLT trying to decide which restaurant to eat in - did a couple of bars en route eating tapas and imbibing beer (def value for money in Madrid! cf. exorbitant London prices) - then gave CLT a go....
review_full: Walked up and down this street outside CLT trying to decide which restaurant to eat in - did a couple of bars en route eating tapas and imbibing beer (def value for money in Madrid! cf. exorbitant London prices) - then gave CLT a go.  English speaking waiter - went with his recommendation cheese and Iberico ham platter, cod and potatoes (yum), husband had steak. Ordered a nice Rioja and then finished off with the rice pudding. Did not realise it was served cold and extremely sweet - as opposed to the traditional English rice pud. so was a wee bit disappointed. However it was a good meal overall and we were just lapping up the atmosphere. Was pretty quiet when we arrived at 9:30 but heaving within the hour. A visit by local mariachi (actually think that's Mexican) who doing their guitar numbers and Gypsy King favourites was a vibrant and noisy end to our evening! Not el cheapo but not OTT pricing. Approx €85 euros for the 2 of us.

review_preview: We were looking for something to eat on a rare rainy, cold evening in Madrid. When we passed this place the staff began saying how good the food was, wanting to entice us in. Normally I don't like this kind of hard sell but as...
review_full: We were looking for something to eat on a rare rainy, cold evening in Madrid. When we passed this place the staff began saying how good the food was, wanting to entice us in. Normally I don't like this kind of hard sell but as we were so cold and hungry we decided to give it a go! Fantastic food - the huge tomatoes with olive oil and salt to start were delicious, and we then had grilled vegetables, cod and a chicken paella between four of us. Washed down with a jug of sangria and some wine, we paid around 20€ each which was great value. The place was packed with a mix of Spanish people and tourists - usually a good sign!

review_preview: My wife and I ate here and had a very good experience.My wife chose the grilled king prawns and a tapas of peppers with tuna. I decided to try the pulpo (octopus).We ordered wine by the glass and were served free tapas whilst...
review_full: My wife and I ate here and had a very good experience. My wife chose the grilled king prawns and a tapas of peppers with tuna. I decided to try the pulpo (octopus). We ordered wine by the glass and were served free tapas whilst our food was prepared. The food arrived in good time and was very well presented.  The king prawns were enormous, plentiful and delicious (if a bit messy to de-shell). I’d tried octopus before whilst on holiday in Greece and was disappointed. This was much better - well cooked, tender and tasty. At the end of our meal we were given a free glass of wine each, which was a nice gesture. The staff weren’t great English speaking, but were helpful and friendly. Although I’ve awarded 5 stars, we noticed that the frescos could do with a bit of attention as some of them are peeling off the wall. However, this didn’t spoil our night at all. Our bill came to around €42, which we thought was good value. The king prawns are highly recommended, as long as you don’t mind the shells.

title_review: The best restaurant we ate in in Madrid.
review_preview: We had dinner here and went back for lunch later in the week. Fantastic food and service and a great central location just beside the Market St Miguel. Their signature dish was the artichoke flowers which were outstanding and the steaks were up there with...
review_full: We had dinner here and went back for lunch later in the week. Fantastic food and service and a great central location just beside the Market St Miguel. Their signature dish was the artichoke flowers which were outstanding and the steaks were up there with the best I've ever had (and I'm a Scottish carnivore so used to very high quality meat). Whole monk fish also excellent and just the right size for two people. Special mention must go to our waitress Julia who was very efficient and friendly and also gave us some very useful info on Madrid. The house wine was also of a very high quality and reasonably priced. Highly recommended.

review_preview: We were around that area and I had El Pimiento Verde on my list of restaurants to try while in Madrid. My wife and I were there "early" for dinner - about 6:30pm - so there was no one there yet. The waitress didn't speak...
review_full: We were around that area and I had El Pimiento Verde on my list of restaurants to try while in Madrid. My wife and I were there "early" for dinner - about 6:30pm - so there was no one there yet. The waitress didn't speak much English (we know very little Spanish) but the menu was easy to understand. We ended up ordering the "monkfish for two" dish and were wondering exactly what we were in for since we've never had it. Wow - what a meal! It was excellent! The fish was done in butter and garlic and came with boiled potatoes around it. The fish itself was like eating lobster (texture/flavors). Considering all the walking we had done and planned to do through our stay, I didn't feel guilty for eating it! Although a bit pricey, I would highly recommend this restaurant. If you plan to eat during normal Europe dinner times (8pm and on) be sure to make a reservation.

An order comes with 5 or 6 young artichokes with the choke and tough leaves stripped away. What's left is totally edible - tender, tasty, and seasoned with olive oil and sea salt. Outstanding! Especially with the fresh bread, olive oil, and plate of olives. Good wine list for reasonable prices. Attentive service and willing to help you order. We ordered one other "starter" besides the artichokes and had plenty of food for 2. With a bottle of nice wine plus several bottles of water, we still stayed under $50. Wish we were staying longer so we could come back. I'd kill for another plate of those artichokes.

review_preview: The choice of eating places in Madrid is bewildering, so I was happy to have the advice of a Madrid-based friend. He recommended El Pimiento Verde, a Basque restaurant, as having "the best artichokes in the world". He told me that the restaurant grows them...
review_full: The choice of eating places in Madrid is bewildering, so I was happy to have the advice of a Madrid-based friend. He recommended El Pimiento Verde, a Basque restaurant, as having "the best artichokes in the world". He told me that the restaurant grows them themselves, so they are available fresh year-round. They have also devised a way of making the inner leaves around the heart fully edible, so they are very easy to eat.  Anyway, we went there on our first evening in the city, and were so impressed that we went two more times.  We had the artichoke "flowers" at every dinner. They are really delicious: simply prepared, and extremely tender without being overcooked. Though a full order has five artichoke flowers, you can also order them individually, if you prefer a smaller portion.  Other highlights among the first courses included Pimientos de Gureníca, small, non-spicy green peppers, simply grilled and served with olive oil and sea salt, and Morcilla (black pudding) formed into little fried cakes with cheese and potatoes.  Superb main courses included Chuletón (grilled beef entrecôte) and a grilled hake fillet with a squid ink sauce topped with grilled baby eels. Also a wonderful Arroz Marinero - a soupy, tomato-based rice dish with fish and seafood.  Excellent wines by the glass and by the bottle. Portions are generous, so I have no idea how good the desserts are! I expect they are delicious too.  This is a friendly, welcoming, non-pretentious restaurant, serving truly outstanding Basque food at very reasonable prices. I would go there for a fourth time today, but, alas, I'm no longer in Madrid.

review_preview: We called at this restaurant having walked out of another one just round the corner without eating after receiving a rude and arrogant reception from the Manager (it's name escapes me I'm afraid). Anyway, I'm so glad we did. The staff at this restaurant were...
review_full: We called at this restaurant having walked out of another one just round the corner without eating after receiving a rude and arrogant reception from the Manager (it's name escapes me I'm afraid). Anyway, I'm so glad we did. The staff at this restaurant were lovely, so helpful and when there was a slight misunderstanding over an order (probably as much our fault as their's) they corrected it without question. The recommendations from the waiter were gratefully received and proved to be well advised. My wife had a T Bone steak and was presented with what was possibly the largest I had ever seen - although there was a fair amount of fat and some gristle but that is to be expected with that cut. I had the Zamburinas (I think!), anyway they were baby scallops in their shells and were the sweetest scallops I have ever had, although a little less sea salt wouldn't have hurt. To drink we had a wonderful Sangria and were given a complimentary small carafe of their equivalent of Baileys - enough for at least two glasses each - it was lovely. The size of the main courses meant we had no room for a sweet, maybe next time.

review_preview: We were shopping in the nearby olive oil specialty shop and we asked the proprietor for a lunch recommendation. She raved about a nearby restaurant, her favorite.  We took her advice and walked a short way to El Pimiento Verde.  What a find.  We shared...
review_full: We were shopping in the nearby olive oil specialty shop and we asked the proprietor for a lunch recommendation. She raved about a nearby restaurant, her favorite. We took her advice and walked a short way to El Pimiento Verde. What a find. We shared 3 dishes, each one superb. We began with their famous artichokes done in olive oil. They were tender and you eat the whole pieces. They were whittled down to the most tender inner petals and heart. Next we had the baby green peppers, grilled in olive oil and sprinkled with sea salt flakes. These were the real thing and they were scrumptious. Finally, we had the creamy mushroom rice with shrimp. This was one of the best risotto's we have ever eaten. It was crunchy and just creamy enough. Our servers, Joy and Julia, were attentive and knew their job. They cleaned away the dirty dishes between courses, and miraculously showed up as we finished each dish. We will return one more time before we leave. This is a do not miss restaurant!

It should come with chistorra (sausage) but I'm vegetarian and they're always happy to ditch the sausage and give me an extra egg. Make sure you cut up the fried eggs as soon as the plate hits the table, then the yolks all mix into the oil and chips. Beers and cheap and plentiful.

title_review: Just had to come back here!
review_preview: I made a very positive review oct 2014 (after 2 visits, with friends) cause we all loved it!So being in Madrid with my family now I just had to come back here...and how they enjoyed it...In fact we came 3 times; for lunch...
review_full: I made a very positive review oct 2014 (after 2 visits, with friends) cause we all loved it! So being in Madrid with my family now I just had to come back here...and how they enjoyed it... In fact we came 3 times; for lunch & dinner. To us, having lunch or dinner is more than just eating, and that's what you experience in 'Venta El Buscon'. The atmosphere is great -especially at night- and soon you'll feel like a local. The waiters may be very busy at times but seeing the joy and the laughter in how they deal with it, makes it even better. Food and quality are just like preferences for colors, so discussions can be endless. We like it because of the reasons already mentioned, but certainly and not in the least because the food is great, certainly for the price you pay!!! If I could find anything similar in Belgium, I would pay even 50% more, with pleasure... To be honest, prices in Madrid are moderate and could easily beat lots of the popular cities throughout Europe... This said, we should all keep in mind what we got and what we payed for it. "Hasta la proxima Tierno é colegas!"

title_review: Unbeatable value, good food, really nice staff, fun place
review_preview: We ended up going here for dinner and lunch consecutively because we knew it would be a solid meal.  Expect very tasty food-- though nothing blew us away as an amazing dish, you will not leave hungry!  The staff is also extremely welcoming and friendly...
review_full: We ended up going here for dinner and lunch consecutively because we knew it would be a solid meal. Expect very tasty food-- though nothing blew us away as an amazing dish, you will not leave hungry! The staff is also extremely welcoming and friendly and speaks some English. The place was very lively both times we went and is festively decorated. First, we were pleasantly surprised to find that both bread and an appetizer (the first time at dinner it was shrimp, the second time at lunch chorizo) were free-- everywhere else we went in Andalucia charged a nominal fee for bread, so it was a pleasant surprise. For dinner we had the meat platter and the grilled vegetable platter. Both were enormous. The meats were very good, though not amazing (except for the chorizo, which was awesome!). We expected the grilled vegetables to be great after reading another review, but they were just plain old veggies. That said, we still left happy because of the good value, paying 25€ for all that food plus a bottle of sparkling water. For lunch we had the goat cheese (awesome), the black pudding (very good, but know what you are eating... or don't like was my case, haha), and the paella (good, not the very best we had on the trip). Again, we were stuffed for a total of 17€, which included two bottles of sparkling water. Fantastic deal!

title_review: Something good, something else not so good
review_preview: We've chosen to eat here due to its proximity to the Placa Mayor and also because the reviews were good. The staff tried their best to accomodate us despite having everything reserved. We've take the Fabada Andalucia which is a bean stew with some chorizo,...
review_full: We've chosen to eat here due to its proximity to the Placa Mayor and also because the reviews were good. The staff tried their best to accomodate us despite having everything reserved. We've take the Fabada Andalucia which is a bean stew with some chorizo, we loved it. We also shared a mixed Paella (even if we knew that the Paella is not a typical dish from Madrid, it's like going to Milan and take the Carbonara, it will still be good, but not Rome-good!) which I have to say was really good as well. Things I didn't like: no one seems to speak English in Madrid, in a Restaurant you should at least have some basics to serve the clients, but most of all, I didn't like what happened with the Wine. We were "tricked" into ordering a bottle rather than having two glasses each because we would have drinked more and that was more convenient. Fair enough, however the wine was among the worst I've ever drank in my life (cheap discount wine sold for 15 euros, be careful) but the horror is that the bottle was already opened, so the wine was recycled from other tables. Check this out when ordering.

title_review: Superb food, wonderful service, a great experience!
review_preview: We were one our way to La Trucha, following the advice of friends. However, upon getting there, we found the place closed -probably because of refurbishment. It had just started raining, so upon turning the street we decided to go into the first place we...
review_full: We were one our way to La Trucha, following the advice of friends. However, upon getting there, we found the place closed -probably because of refurbishment. It had just started raining, so upon turning the street we decided to go into the first place we liked the look of -this happened to be Venta El Buscón. Were we lucky? Oh, yes! Wonderful atmosphere, simple and nice, fast and cordial service, simple yet delicious food. We had the garlic prawns in the over, along with the succulent fried calamari, the fried fish platter and a nice salad. We were about to order some more things, but the nice waiter said this was way too much for two people -and he was right! The portions are more than satisfactory. Despite having a dinner with fish and seafood, we opted for Rioja. The calamari we had in La Bardemcilla de Santa Ana round the corner a couple of days ago was like plastic and arrived when we were about to ask for the bill. Here the calamari was springy with a light batter and reminded us of good -rare find- Greek seafood. The aioli garlicky mix of the prawns had just the needed hint of chilli and the fried fish/seafood platter was excellent as main. These were more than enough for two people. We are in Madrid only for a few days, but we shall definitely be visiting again. Thank you to both of the wonderful waiters for great service! (Btw: one of the few places were the music is nice enough, unobtrusive and we could still hear ourselves without shouting).

review_preview: Some friends who live in Madrid recommended this place, and what surprised me most about it was that it's right in the middle of a touristy area not far from the Plaza Mayor. It was one of the best meals I had in Madrid though....
review_full: Some friends who live in Madrid recommended this place, and what surprised me most about it was that it's right in the middle of a touristy area not far from the Plaza Mayor. It was one of the best meals I had in Madrid though. The service was friendly and helpful- our server told us what the house specialities were and they did not disappoint. We started with artichokes- amazing. I don't know how they got them so tender, but they were delicious and unlike anything I've had before. We then had a few fish courses- the squid ink croquettes were a novel and delicious dish and a calamari in caramelized onion that was almost perfect- tender and sweet, a nice departure from the usual fried. The final course was steak, cooked rare and then served on a warm plate so it kept cooking on the table. Delicious. I really can't say enough nice things about this place, it was everything a restaurant should be.

review_preview: We had 3 different but similar restaurants in mind after checking TripAdvisor and saw this one first, walking from Sol metro station.  We ended up with a very drinkable bottle of Rioja (Graciosa €14), and 3 "starters" between 2 of us.  Be warned, the portions...
review_full: We had 3 different but similar restaurants in mind after checking TripAdvisor and saw this one first, walking from Sol metro station. We ended up with a very drinkable bottle of Rioja (Graciosa €14), and 3 "starters" between 2 of us. Be warned, the portions are bigger than tapas! We shared Patatas con 3 Salsas (potatoes with spicy, garlic, and BBQ sauces), Tortilla Espanola (Traditional Potato Omlette) and Paella Marinera (traditional rice with seafood). All were delicious, and portions were plentiful. We couldn't even eat the bread served with it. The total bill was less than €40, and we had excellent service too. The ambiance was great, and we walked in just before 9pm without a reservation on a Monday. Busy but well worth a visit! Free anise liqueurs on the house with the bill.

review_preview: Mistakenly ate here while intending to eat at a place that a friend had recommended.  A delicious mistake.  Now I have a place to recommend.  We liked this place so much we ate here twice in one week.  The first time we had the grilled...
review_full: Mistakenly ate here while intending to eat at a place that a friend had recommended. A delicious mistake. Now I have a place to recommend. We liked this place so much we ate here twice in one week. The first time we had the grilled meat platter and a grilled veggie platter. The meat platter was as good as another review says, but it was the veggies that brought us back. In some ways, spanish cooking doesn't know what to do with veggies, so it was great to find a dish in which a variety of fresh, simply grilled vegetables were featured. The second time, we added the gambas al ajillo. OMG, so good I had to get the recipe. We soaked up every last bit of the sauce with crusty bread - my toddler asks for this dish all the time. The service is fast and good, and our servers were genuinely friendly and fun. The place is crowded in a bustling, friendly way. It's good for kids because the noise level means your kids can relax a bit, but it's not a "kid's place" per se because the tables are tight and there is drinking and smoking.

title_review: Great value on meat, and sangria that will kick you in the skull (in a good way)
review_preview: This little restaurant in the heart of Madrid, a few blocks away from Puerta del Sol, may have one of the best value-for-money deals: a plate of grilled meats, with salad or fries, for two people, at 18 euros. The chef know's what he's doing,...
review_full: This little restaurant in the heart of Madrid, a few blocks away from Puerta del Sol, may have one of the best value-for-money deals: a plate of grilled meats, with salad or fries, for two people, at 18 euros. The chef know's what he's doing, too: warm and spicy chorizos sit atop flavorful pork and beef. One of the best plates we had in Madrid at any price. As for wine: Spain, as a country, does not generally skimp on the alcohol in cocktails or sangria. But even by Spanish standards, Venta el Buscon's sangria stands out as notably potent. Flavorful and only slightly fruity, a jug of this may well knock you off your feet.

review_preview: This restaurant is fantastic. Went twice whilst on a 5 night break in Madrid. The seafood paella is beautiful, would definitely recommend it. When we returned for the 2nd night the staff recognised us and treated us like royalty. I had lamb cutlets and the...
review_full: This restaurant is fantastic. Went twice whilst on a 5 night break in Madrid. The seafood paella is beautiful, would definitely recommend it. When we returned for the 2nd night the staff recognised us and treated us like royalty. I had lamb cutlets and the husband had veal. Both were to die for!! My husband's veal was possibly the best meat I have even eaten. The house wine was gorgeous and great value. We received bread, ham and cheese on arrival both nights, which was free of charge. We also received a complimentary drink with the bill. The atmosphere was friendly and relaxed; we weren't rushed and the staff were happy for us to stay at our table for a couple of drinks after our meal.  All in all, a fantastic experience. Delicious food, great atmosphere and brilliant staff.

Affordable prices. Definitely, a good choice for a family lunch.

I would like to suggest this restaurant as a nice experience for tasting great Korean gastronomy and a very pleasant ambient.

I am not in a position to determine whether the food is authentic or not, as I have never been to Korea, however I do wish it was more spicy. We happen to love spice, but you have to keep in mind this is difficult for a restaurant in Spain as the general Spanish public has a very low tolerance to spice and they would get loads of complaints. I can specifically recommend their vegetable tempura and most of their hotplate dishes - they are delish! 11€ weekday lunchtime menus, and around 25€/pp for a la carte. Booking essential for Fri and Sat nights.

review_preview: After reading many good reviews about this place, I convince my friend to go have a dinner with me. I was craving for some spicy Korean food when I am visiting Spain. Here is what I think of this place. Keep in mind, I was...
review_full: After reading many good reviews about this place, I convince my friend to go have a dinner with me. I was craving for some spicy Korean food when I am visiting Spain. Here is what I think of this place. Keep in mind, I was born & grow up in Korea. 1. It is just shame u call this place a Korean restaurant who serves Korean food. In my life, I never had a Korean restaurant charges banchan!!! All those side dishes are supposedly free! They are charging kimchi 5 euros!  2. After talking to the waiter, they gave me kimchi & seasoned tofu as a service. So I can say their service was good. The waiter wasn't Korean but speak Korean well. 3. I ordered spicy squid with noodle & my friend ordered kimchi jigae (kimchi tofu soup), tinto de verano. Spicy squid tasted like Chinese food & they used linguini noodles! No Korean spicy squid dish uses linguini noodles!!! Definitely not taste like Chinese! I had to ask go-choojang(red pepper paste) & crushed red pepper to make it spicier. Btw, I did tell them make mine really spicy... My friend's kimchi soup was better than I thought but not worth more than €13!  4. Fee kimchi... Way too old & I am so glad they gave to us for free. Otherwise after I paid €5 for that old stinky kimchi, I would been screaming.  5. I got the bill, over €33 for our lunch. They charged €4.5 for the drink, €2.5for rice. I mean what kind of Korean restaurant charges a bowl of rice when u order kimchi soup????  The waiter said that is what they do in Spain. So here is my thought...  U r in Spain. Eat Spanish dish when u r in Spain. Try authentic Spanish dish. Korean food can wait until when u go back home.  Not worth my money, totally disappointed & wish I spent that money in Spanish tradition dish...

We were so overwhelmed by the quantity that we cancelled the meat but even so were over faced. The food was simple bistro fare but with top-quality ingredients, the atmosphere very sociably Spanish, and the service attentive, particularly to the Spanish-speaking lady among us. In addition, a doggy bag with the excess shrimps was willingly provided. The bill was a little OTT at 260 euros but all in all a good experience. Beware you don't get stampeded into ordering more than you want to eat or pay for, though.

review_preview: We stumbled across the Cantina La Traviesa after walking back from making a future dinner reservation at Botin, just a few steps away.  We noticed it was packed and there were wine glasses in everyone's hands and decided this was a place for us to...
review_full: We stumbled across the Cantina La Traviesa after walking back from making a future dinner reservation at Botin, just a few steps away. We noticed it was packed and there were wine glasses in everyone's hands and decided this was a place for us to try, at least for a drink. We started at the bar and found the house red to be outstanding. We were served some iberico ham and manchego and stood at the bar observing the crowd. Plates of wonderful food came out to those seated and behind the bar one of the owners was slicing away at the ham. We had three glasses standing at the crowded bar when the other owner came over and insisted we sit down at a table, just to be more comfortable. I am so glad he did! We ordered a full platter of the ham and cheese we were served at the bar and decided to try the house specialty, the cod. It was prepared in a sauce that was simply outstanding! We had some grilled vegetables that were done to perfection and finished off our meal with some wonderful house made creme caramel liquor. There was live entertainment and the owners treated us like we were regulars. They urged us to come back the following night to eat with them and took photographs with us. If I could pick a single restaurant in all of Madrid that I could actually eat dinner at every single night without tiring, and feel like a member of the family, this would be the place. It is "that" good!

Overall, it was a fairly pleasant experience but the food was just ok.

The food is consistently good quality and well cooked, but it is really the front of house staff who make this experience. Years go by and many of the staff are the same, and a pleasure to see. review_preview: I have been to Buscon a few times now and it has never disappointed. The dishes are superb value for central Madrid (refreshing not to get ripped off as a non-Spaniard), and the portions are large, one plate maximum per person for sure, I think...
review_full: I have been to Buscon a few times now and it has never disappointed. The dishes are superb value for central Madrid (refreshing not to get ripped off as a non-Spaniard), and the portions are large, one plate maximum per person for sure, I think most people over order not anticipating this! The food and drink are generally good quality, not top quality, but perfectly adequate for the price. They serve bulls tail (rabo de toro), meatballs, paella, ham, chips, egg and a selection of other typical Spanish food. Sophistication is not their strong point but the place is always busy and cheerful.  The service is friendly and a little playful, but in good heart. Being so close to Sol it is super busy, especially Friday and Saturday nights for groups bigger than two people! Expect to wait for a table at the bar with a drink if you go peak times, peak days.  Overall not to be missed for superb value tapas and some good Sangria in the heart of Madrid.

review_full: We thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant. We ate there twice during our stay in Madrid (very rare for us).  It's lively and friendly. The food was good, servings were huge. We loved the grilled vegetable plate, but weren't crazy about the shrimp toast. We met several tourists there from France, Spain and the UK. It doesn't have a touristy feel.  The best thing it has is a server named Sebastian. This guy was incredible. We loved watching him work. He welcomed everyone who walked in with a big loud "Buenos" and then literally ran around the restaurant taking care of seemingly everyone and everything. The entire time he was working at an incredible pace, he was smiling, laughing and interacting with everyone around. We got in a conversation with 2 young Frenchmen beside us and because he needed their table, he bought them each a glass of wine at the bar. Such a smart, positive way of moving them along. He also informed us that were were going to order too much food, which we appreciated. We were so enamored with him that I'm posting my first picture ever on Tripadvisor! Go see Sebastian....

title_review: A great little restaurant....do not miss it!
review_preview: After spending 20 days of traveling around Spain and mostly eating Tapas, I ended my tour in Madrid for 3 days / 2 nights. Having walked along Calle Cava Baja and found nothing of interest, I stumbled upon this restaurant. I was so impressed with...
review_full: After spending 20 days of traveling around Spain and mostly eating Tapas, I ended my tour in Madrid for 3 days / 2 nights.  Having walked along Calle Cava Baja and found nothing of interest, I stumbled upon this restaurant. I was so impressed with the friendliness and food at this restaurant that i actually ate here for both nights in Madrid. The jovial waiter standing by the restaurant door way made a friendly comment and we started chatting. I had a look at the menu and asked him for a table for 2. The restaurant was full (manly locals with only about 8 tables) and the waiter asked me to wait 10 minutes at the bar (with a free drink) and then he would have a table for me and my wife.  The menu was extensive and very reasonably priced and had some dishes that I had not seen before. The food was delicious and all the waiters were very friendly and treated us as if we were long standing customers/friends. I can recommend the whole squid Euro 14 (stuffed with cod and vegetables), the ox tail stew Euro 13, very large plate of iberico ham Euro 15, large garlic prawns Euro 14 and the Razor Clams Euro 13 . The bottle of wine i chose Euro 20 was out of stock and the waiter was very apologetic and allowed me to have another more expensive bottle Euro 25 at the same price! The owner came around during the meal and made sure all was ok. At the end of the meal, a bottle of their locally produced liquer was placed on the table as a thank you......i was allowed to take as much as i liked for free! The second night was even better and the owner and waiters recognised us and treated us as royalty for the night. This restuarant does have a large following of locals and i would suggest you get to the restaurant by 8.30pm to ensure you get a table.

title_review: Best ever Spanish restaurant I have been in spain
review_preview: I have gone from Barcelona to valencia then Madrid in 12 days and I must say this was the best restaurant I have been. I saw very good reviews so I decided to give it a shot.  We were welcomed by a very cheerful Spanish...
review_full: I have gone from Barcelona to valencia then Madrid in 12 days and I must say this was the best restaurant I have been. I saw very good reviews so I decided to give it a shot. We were welcomed by a very cheerful Spanish man who have made us feel at home. After seeing the menu which is really Spanish food we have decided to go with things we don't eat everyday. Drinks we decided to try their sangria and the waiter quickly went to the bar and brought a small glass of sangria as sample to Try and obviously it was perfect. My kids choosed the tripe and cod they were amazing. My wife took shrimps in garlic, mother in law some anchovies and I took the bulls tail ........omg the bulls tail..just wow. As desert we took a mixed plate and everything was very good. He brought us as well some liquor similar to baileys which he said they make it themselves. That liquor made my wife very happy. All in all it's not some posh restaurant but who cares all that matters when you go to eat is good food, great service with great smile. Rest assured I'm going back here for sure.

title_review: Best lunch I've ever had in Madrid!
review_preview: It wasn't just a fantastic food but it was an unforgettable experience!We were looking for a nice restaurant in LA LATINA and Ramon - most charm-full waiter - offered us jamon de bellota. Haven't tried such a good jamon before. After trying it we...
review_full: It wasn't just a fantastic food but it was an unforgettable experience! We were looking for a nice restaurant in LA LATINA and Ramon - most charm-full waiter - offered us jamon de bellota. Haven't tried such a good jamon before. After trying it we sat down and ordered the POLLO AL AJILLO. Huge plate... Delicious!! Meanwhile Ramon was there laughing with us....just sharing stories! We had never met such a nice waiter - after a while we could even consider him a friend.  When we were done with lunch we ordered two coffees. A normal "americano" and a "bombon". The second was a single espresso with condensed milk... Yummy!! After that Ramon gave us a bottle of a Spanish Bailyes. Yep gave us - for free! And as if that wasn't enough we even got a bottle of olive oil that I'll take to Dubai with me :) Apart from the super tasty food, the free chupitos, what made this experience so great was the service and the flavor of their food ! 100% recommended for all!! Taking my business partners there next week!

review_preview: So this isnt a review of their food, as we had already eaten and were just walking by, but I had to come here and tell everyone about the owner and his wonderful father.We had just eaten at San Miguel Market, and were strolling...
review_full: So this isnt a review of their food, as we had already eaten and were just walking by, but I had to come here and tell everyone about the owner and his wonderful father. We had just eaten at San Miguel Market, and were strolling back to Lavapies, when I spotted a handsome older gentleman with a brilliant 'tache hanging outside a tapas bar. He caught my eye and shouted 'Hola!' and waved us over. We went over to speak to him, he in Spanish, my boyfriend didnt understand a word, and I myself with a basic grip of the language! But pretty soon the three of us were laughing, gesturing, loosely trying to translate each other etc, through a basic school knowledge of spanish we learnt that this man, Lolo, was the father of the owner of Cantina La Traviesa, and a pretty big cheese of the local area! He let us try their jamon (delicious!) and then to thank him, i tried to buy him a drink, of course this elderly gentleman wouldn't hear of taking money from us and instead bought US drinks instead!  So there we were, laughing and drinking beer on the street with this lovely old guy, when his son (the owner) came out to see what was going on!! Soon he was telling us that Lolo was a Karate champion of 40 years, I translated this to my boyfriend who is a jujitsu instructor, who then immediately started calling him Sensei and then they were mock-fighting in the street, Lolo taking his jacket off and putting up his dukes XD  They are a lovely lovely family, we met the owners wife too, after they closed up the shop Lolo took us over the road to a cuban Jazz cafe (i think it was called the something-negra...) where everyone knew him. There we were bought beer, shots of grappa, and mojitos, it was unbelievable hospitality with a simple lesson that now we must do the same and pass this generosity forward in our own country! Lolo said that he simply enjoys chatting to people, and that tourists don't like to talk as much as he'd hoped, so if you're here, please go visit this place and have some of their delicious jamon! And chat to them! My spanish is rubbish but i've found most people in madrid to have a good sense of humour, make them laugh and youre golden :) Our flight was leaving the next day and we simply didn't have time to go back to eat, I wish we could have!

title_review: OK, but not as good as the reviews suggested
review_preview: Myself and a friend visited Venta El Buscon on a four night stay in Madrid in August on the basis the tripadvisor reviews were so good. Unfortunately, for us it was not as good. We went for lunch and ordered some soft drinks and three...
review_full: Myself and a friend visited Venta El Buscon on a four night stay in Madrid in August on the basis the tripadvisor reviews were so good. Unfortunately, for us it was not as good. We went for lunch and ordered some soft drinks and three tapas, the ham croquettes, patatas bravas and beef meatballs. There was some struggle with language (our fault that we don't speak more spanish) but we pointed out all three items on the menu in the end and we thought we had got our point across. When the food came out, instead of the ham croquettes we were brought ham, egg and chips. The patatas bravas, which on the menu said came with two sauces, only came with the salsa sauce and the meatballs came out 10mins after everything else, in a gravy sauce with chips in it. So we ended up with potatoes, meatball and potatoes and ham, egg and potatoes, despite only ordering one lot of potatoes! Instead of complaining about the ham egg and chips we did our best to get on with it and just eat the ham and leave the rest. When we had finished the same waiter refused to take our plates twice because we hadnt eatent the egg and chips, so unfortunately we ended up having to tell him the order had been wrong. He was very apologetic and brought out two croquettes which were actually very nice. Food quality wise wasn't as good as other restaurants, the meatballs were tasteless and the patatas bravas were not as good as the restaurant round the corner, it was also more expensive than the place round the corner, where in our opinion, the food is better,however compared to other places in madrid it was cheap. Perhaps maybe we just had a bad experience but I would not go there again.

title_review: Excellent Budget meals in Central Madrid
review_preview: Having seen how expensive and uninteresting  the typical tourist places are in central Madrid, we were delighted to find this place, using the Tripadvisor website recommendations. It is situated near the Plaza del Sol and is a small bar/ restaurant with a larger downstairs dining...
review_full: Having seen how expensive and uninteresting the typical tourist places are in central Madrid, we were delighted to find this place, using the Tripadvisor website recommendations. It is situated near the Plaza del Sol and is a small bar/ restaurant with a larger downstairs dining area. The ground floor bar /restaurant is air conditioned and has a large digital t.v.. The decor is a mix of old and modern shabby chic and is themed for the Cervantes novel the place is named after - well that's what the waiters told me. We ate there three nights running- the seafood is very fresh, well cooked and the portions are generous . Would recommend the padrilla[ ? spelling] of mixed seafood - 2 kinds of very large prawns, langoustine and another critter I can't name - all were delicious, washed down with a glass of cold Manzanilla. We also tried the steak and it was very tender and tasty . The waiters are all very friendly and have much better English than I have Spanish, so we managed some banter over the 2012 Euros,and yes, I was correct, Torres came good for them.

review_full: This is the restaurant in the city center to sample the Spanish most sought after fine food: El Jamón Ibérico de Bellota. Sort of a sofisticated bacon. Their tuna pies are another must, empanadilla. I ve heard very good things of their stake and I have tasted their meat paella once and found it very tasty and way better that the microwave paella served in most of the restaurants. Watch out! a paella takes 30 minutes to be made, if your paella arrives in less time it was MICROWAVED!!!

review_full: Came here for lunch with a local friend who recommended this restaurant that specialises in Basque cuisine. He managed to reserve a table despite the restaurant being full. We had a wonderful lunch with entrees of the famed grilled artichokes, a salad and the fried squid with a special tartare sauce. The artichoke is a must-have! I've never tasted such well prepared artichoke before. For mains we had the beef steak with foie gras and the cod dish. Both were excellent. The steak had a special red wine sauce that had a lovely flavour. We were too full to have dessert. Definitely recommended. Easily to find - just next to Mercado de San Miguel's side entry (next to Plaza Mayor).

review_preview: If you're looking for excellent Spanish food, a great atmosphere and attentive service then you must visit this restaurant.  We enjoyed 3 large plates of tapas between 4 people and were very full - thank goodness the staff were on hand to guide us through...
review_full: If you're looking for excellent Spanish food, a great atmosphere and attentive service then you must visit this restaurant.  We enjoyed 3 large plates of tapas between 4 people and were very full - thank goodness the staff were on hand to guide us through the menu and ensure that we didn't over order. In fact the menu is so large and all the dishes sounded so delicious that we simply asked the waiter for his recommendations, which were spot on. The bottle of cava we had to start our experience was lovely and at only EUR 15.00 it was very well priced as were all other drinks including the cocktails which we enjoyed in the bar after dinner. The only downside is that this restaurant is a little way out and you will need to take a cab, but its worth the 10-15 minute drive and you won't be disappointed! This restaurant was the highlight of my weekend in Madrid and I can't wait to go back!

title_review: Had a terrific time at Alcaravea!
review_preview: We decided to have a dinner at Alcaravea based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor (of course, as we always check out!).The restaurant itself doesn't appear special on first sight, but the ambience seemed nice. The service was great, we were helped by a...
review_full: We decided to have a dinner at Alcaravea based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor (of course, as we always check out!). The restaurant itself doesn't appear special on first sight, but the ambience seemed nice. The service was great, we were helped by a friendly, humorous man who speaks English, this was very helpful because the menu is all in Spanish and our level of Spanish is not that great. The food was delicious (and the portions are sufficient too, it's no need to order more than 2 dishes for 2 persons!) and good value for what you pay. What we liked about this restaurant is that it's a typical Spanish place, full of locals and practically no other tourists. The waiter was surprised that we, foreigners, knew about this place! The experience is truely different than going to a restaurant in the city center, but in a good way. Definitly recommendable!

review_preview: My husband and I enjoyed a lovely dinner at the Alcaravea Restaurant on Cea Bermudez, Madrid.  The food was deliciously prepared, the wine excellent, and the servers and owner, Caesar, were all so very attentive.  We sampled four appetizers and two entrees which was more...
review_full: My husband and I enjoyed a lovely dinner at the Alcaravea Restaurant on Cea Bermudez, Madrid. The food was deliciously prepared, the wine excellent, and the servers and owner, Caesar, were all so very attentive. We sampled four appetizers and two entrees which was more than enough food! All the food was fresh and tasty, prepared with interesting cheeses and flavors. Enjoying the dinner so much, we decided to return two nights later with a party of 17 people. It was a different experience and we encountered a bit of a language barrier because our group spoke French and English only. Because our group was so large, Caesar explained that it would be best if our whole party ordered tapas only. He explained that if we all ordered entrees, that not all the food would come out together. This was a bit disappointing, but, we understood that the kitchen could not accomodate preparing and serving 17 dinners simulataneously. In retrospect, I feel our group was too large for this lovely little place, and, we are much appreciative to Caesar and his employees for doing their best to make our evening special. I would definitely recommend making reservations, dining earlier rather than later, and keeping your party to a maximum of 6 persons. Definitely visit this restaurant when you are in Madrid. And remember to use your TA Madrid app to locate wonderful restaurants such as Alcaravea!

title_review: An Enjoyable Dining Experience Near the Mercado and Plaza Mayor
review_preview: We enjoyed this restaurant by our apartment rental, very near the Mercado San Miguel and Plaza Mayor. The monkfish for 2 was excellent—tender and not overcooked. My son enjoyed the lobster dish. The house wine offerings were very good, and reasonably priced. We were very...
review_full: We enjoyed this restaurant by our apartment rental, very near the Mercado San Miguel and Plaza Mayor. The monkfish for 2 was excellent—tender and not overcooked. My son enjoyed the lobster dish. The house wine offerings were very good, and reasonably priced. We were very impressed with the artichoke “flowers” as our main appetizer. Our only regret was not asking for lemon to cut the coarsely-ground sea salt, which was applied a little too heavily. We would definitely return on a visit back to this area. It’s a very good value for the price. We made a reservation, but it wasn't necessary because we are "early" diners by Spaniard standards. If you go before 8:30 you probably don't need one. The place was full by the time we left.

Wide variety of choice, we had eggs, mushrooms, salads, octopus, fish, calamari but there was also a lot of meat. Perfect service The decor of the place was also very nice with a ground floor with regular looking tables and a basement with great curtains separating tables. The price was also a treat at around 10 euro per dish.

title_review: Thanks to the previous reviewers of this restaurant!
review_preview: Because we had the best meal of our vacation, including not only Madrid, but Paris and Barcelona -- and we really didn’t have a bad meal anywhere. The experience was greatly enhanced by the attentive service of the owner/manager Cesar, who was friendly, knowledgeable and...
review_full: Because we had the best meal of our vacation, including not only Madrid, but Paris and Barcelona -- and we really didn’t have a bad meal anywhere. The experience was greatly enhanced by the attentive service of the owner/manager Cesar, who was friendly, knowledgeable and couldn't be more helpful in advising us on the menu's offerings. A restaurateur who truly loves his profession! As for the food, well, let me say that when one gets excited by a zucchini dish, there is something very special going on! Along with that cheese filled zucchini, we had tomato and burrata salad, croquettes, octopus. Iberian pork loin, Kobe beef mini-burgers, a tortilla pie and chocolate and carrot cake for dessert, all served family style and each dish distinctive and truly excellent. The bill for all this plus wine and other drinks for 6 people? About €40 a person. A very reasonable amount for such a distinctive meal!

title_review: Best meal we had in Madrid
review_preview: My husband and I have been to Madrid about 5 or 6 times and we found out about this restaurant by accident.  We had the owner's son Cesar, who was managing that night, order for us.  After talking with us for a few minutes to...
review_full: My husband and I have been to Madrid about 5 or 6 times and we found out about this restaurant by accident. We had the owner's son Cesar, who was managing that night, order for us. After talking with us for a few minutes to get our tastes he made several suggestions. We told him to go ahead and order for us. The portions are HUGE - share everything and order half of what you think you want! It was so good we went back a 2nd time before leaving. Louisa, not sure this is how to spell her name, was our waitress. Spoke great English was very friendly and knew the menu very well. Buratta mozzarella with tomatoes was wonderful! Everything was very fresh. Zucchini flowerets with a balsamic reduction sauce, roasted lamb cooked Spanish style with peppers and beef cheek stew which was amazing. We saved room for blueberry cheesecake for dessert the 2nd time as I had seen it on our first visit. The wait staff go out of their way to accomodate you and also explain how big the portions are. We will be adding this to our must list. So worth the metro ride you will not be disappointed.

title_review: The best Italian food I've had in Madrid
review_preview: I follow a very strict diet and generally avoided Italian restaurants in Madrid because of their ultra greasy, heavy food and ingredients that tasted like they have just been quickly defrosted and not fresh made. Flavia on the other hand was the first Italian restaurant...
review_full: I follow a very strict diet and generally avoided Italian restaurants in Madrid because of their ultra greasy, heavy food and ingredients that tasted like they have just been quickly defrosted and not fresh made.  Flavia on the other hand was the first Italian restaurant to offer diet options like gluten free pasta and pizza all while keeping it authentically Italian. I was very impressed with the creativity and attention to detail on the items in their menu, and most importantly the freshness of all their ingredients, which is very rare with Italian restaurants in Madrid. My favorite dish is the sexy pasta Bolognese which is their gluten free no calorie pasta option made from Japanese mushroom roots, I have never seen this option on any Italian restaurant’s menu anywhere in the world.  Also make sure to try their espresso martini, which is the best I’ve had anywhere and I do try them everywhere from the best bars and restaurants in Dubai to London to Hong Kong.

I had the lasagna bolognese , it was true Italian and not smothered with cheese or sauce and the perfect combo of pasta ,cheese and meat . Great service and friendly staff . review_full: As a member of the "Accademia della Cucina Italiana" I enjoy trying italian restaurants abroad, especially where they exibit the logo of the Accademia right under the menu. My experience was very disappointing as far as the food is concerned. My rating would be as follows: Service 5 stars: welcoming and dedicate. Ambience 5 stars: very nice local; trendy. Food 1 star: as far as the italian cousine is concerned my spaghetti alla carbonara were one of the worst I had in my life; far from enjoyable. Also the pasta of my friends was largely disappointing, with both the sauce and the consistency of the pasta not reaching a good standard. Only the "lasagne" were satisfying. As for the tiramisu, I wouldn't repeat the experience. Bad luck that night or just a non recommendable restaurant? I will leave that to you... ...but I wouldn't repeat, especially with all the good italian restaurants that one may find in Madrid.

title_review: Excellent Italian fod in a modern stylish restaurant

The staff were friendly and attentative and the pizzas were excellent. The puddings were home made and wonderful. The wine was delicious. The surroundings are modern and interesting. Our daughters (16 and 17) loved the stylish interior and the relaxed atmosphere. We were very impressed and will be seeking out Flavias again when we are next in Madrid.

title_review: O.K. but not as pleasant as expected!
review_preview: Made reservations for June 29, 2013 at 21:00 for 8 people, 32 hours in advance.  This to celebrate my wife's birthday (I told them this when res. made but no birthday things appeared).  We all arrived at the restaurant on time or early except for...
review_full: Made reservations for June 29, 2013 at 21:00 for 8 people, 32 hours in advance. This to celebrate my wife's birthday (I told them this when res. made but no birthday things appeared). We all arrived at the restaurant on time or early except for 2 people who came in at 21:30 due to personal conflicts. We were finally seated by ourselves after a waiter said that it was alright to sit where we did. Pre-meal wine showed up after we asked for it, the wine was good and was reasonably priced. The acoustics in this restaurant are NOT good, they need sound deadning material on the ceiling therefore we could not hear well the specials of the evening, these were not written down anywhere. To make the long story short we didn't know what the specials were and many of the items on the main menu were not available, the 3 types of bacalaus for example. I finally ordered the chicken salad plate which never arrived. When we asked for more wine the waitress brought the wrong bottle. The pre-meal food was excellent and what did arrive was excellent as well. We were warned that we had to get out at 23:00, this as 22:45 despite the fact that some of our food STILL had not arrived. We finally cancelled whatever had not arrived and left the restaurant at around 23:15 despite the fact that there were empty tables. All in all I would advise management to staff for Saturday night which I am sure is always busy, as it was they appeared to be short handed and eager for us to get the heck out. Total bill for 8 people was 273.27 Euros or $355.25 plus tip.

With three beers and three glasses of wine, our total came to 58 euros. Needless to say, we will be back.

title_review: Adventurous and extensive menu - two thumbs up!
review_preview: We were reaching a point in our vacation where we were discovering that most eateries in Spain tend to be conservative in their range and way of cooking - each restaurant was very "safe" in their choices and as a result, the variety tends to...
review_full: We were reaching a point in our vacation where we were discovering that most eateries in Spain tend to be conservative in their range and way of cooking - each restaurant was very "safe" in their choices and as a result, the variety tends to be limited.  Alcaravea was different from the moment you open the menu - salads alone took up an entire page. And many of the cooking styles and ingredients used were different. We had no idea what to order really but was given recommendations by their servers and yes, we totally agree with the reviews here - this place is a two thumbs up! We went twice in our our 5 day stay in Madrid. The absolute best dish we had there was the Cod Fish. Absolutely superb.  We also found out that their seafood comes in on Thursdays, so if you are able to head there towards the end of the week - that's probably when the menu is at its most extensive and at its freshest.  We didn't make reservations so we turned up at 7 pm (the kitchen opens at 8 pm) and managed to get some outdoor seats. For their indoor seats, reservations are a requirement. HIghly recommended.

review_preview: After almost nearly two years, we happily returned to Alcaravea and once again were not disappointed.  The great service and delicious food continue. The Secreto Pork is NOT to be missed; It is a highly sought-after pork, a special cut, from the famous Bellota Pigs....
review_full: After almost nearly two years, we happily returned to Alcaravea and once again were not disappointed. The great service and delicious food continue. The Secreto Pork is NOT to be missed; It is a highly sought-after pork, a special cut, from the famous Bellota Pigs. Make sure to order half portions of everything because the portions are generous and that allows more room in your tummy to try as many dishes as possible. The fish, the calamari, the mushrooms, the green peppers are all favorite dishes. Can't recommend this place enough!

review_preview: This was a lucky choice as I used Tripadvisor as a guide , but at the time this was well down the list....The staff were very welcoming and helpful advising us on the menu. We had heard that the barbecued beef was very good...
review_full: This was a lucky choice as I used Tripadvisor as a guide , but at the time this was well down the list.... The staff were very welcoming and helpful advising us on the menu. We had heard that the barbecued beef was very good so we went with that as well as some bbq octopus and a salad and some chips. The KILO of beef ( between 2)was served rare and ready sliced for us and was delicious and they offered to cook it a little more if we thought it was too rare. The Octopus was my favourite being crispy on outside and super tender inside and seasoned beautifully. The owner recommended a Ribeiro del Duero which at €30 was not cheap but was the classiest thing that passed my lips that week , and a perfect partner to the beef. We the succumbed to the cheeseboard which had some delicious and interesting local cheeses. All in all a terrific find and one I'd recommend to anyone visiting Madrid looking for authentic home cooking away from the tourist traps at a reasonable price.  I have to add that our visit was in 2014 , but I seriously doubt it's changed much , going by some of the more recent comments .

title_review: The best restaurant in all of Madrid!
review_preview: We came on our first night by just taking a chance on your restaurant. We got very lucky when we dropped in Alcaravea. Cesar seated us immediately and brought over appetizers and took our drink orders. Then he came back and explained in English, because...
review_full: We came on our first night by just taking a chance on your restaurant. We got very lucky when we dropped in Alcaravea. Cesar seated us immediately and brought over appetizers and took our drink orders. Then he came back and explained in English, because we don't understand Spanish, all of the specials of today. Cesar recommended we share plates. We had the tomatoes and mozzarella, the zucchini, the calamari, and the croquettes. We had plans for the other two nights in Madrid, however everything was so delicious on the first night we decided to go back the following night. Again, Cesar ordered for us. We had the beef cheeks, the octopus, and the lima beans. For dessert we had an amazing cheese platter. However, last night was our wedding anniversary. Because of Caesar's hospitality and the amazing food cooked from all-natural ingredients we just couldn't resist. We went back for the third night and had the white tuna, the sirloin steak, a salad, and the fried mushrooms. Once again we had the cheese assortment for dessert while my daughter had her the chocolate cake. Ceaser brought out the beef before it was prepared to view and explains it's organic history. He also took my son back to see the ham, the tuna, and let him go down and help pick out the cheese. What a great experience. If you are visiting in Madrid I would suggest that you try this restaurant at least once, you won't regret it. Authentic Spanish cooking at its finest. Jerry and family-Florida

review_preview: I was looking for a restaurant near to my hotel.  Alcaravea was 15 minutes walk away.  The kitchen opens at 8pm so we had a drink in the bar.  There were little plates to keep us going. Cold cuts, cheese and great tasting liver.  The...
review_full: I was looking for a restaurant near to my hotel. Alcaravea was 15 minutes walk away. The kitchen opens at 8pm so we had a drink in the bar. There were little plates to keep us going. Cold cuts, cheese and great tasting liver. The meal in the restaurant was very good. There was an excellent ratatouille with eggs ans a special Iberian pork cut with Iberian ham which was excellent. The pork was served with sliced potatoes and pimentos padron. The waiters were friendly recommended some great wines. It was a good rounded experience and well worth a visit especially if you are only in town for one night. They have an English menu if your Spanish is not as good as their English!

title_review: Food That Makes Your Soul Sing!! Back again!
review_preview: We dined at Alcaravea in 2012  (they really remembered us!!) and we experienced Spain's best meal - "Secreto Pork! And again, 2 years later, nothing changed - it was succulent, and like no other pork we've ever eaten!  The service is very personal, pleasant and...
review_full: We dined at Alcaravea in 2012 (they really remembered us!!) and we experienced Spain's best meal - "Secreto Pork! And again, 2 years later, nothing changed - it was succulent, and like no other pork we've ever eaten! The service is very personal, pleasant and all dishes explained in detail and now they thankfully have "half-orders" so you can enjoy more of their delicious food! While waiting for kitchen to open for dinner (8:30pm), we were served wonderful Mojitos and had chicken wings and roasted potatoes that were just amazing by their charming bartenders! For dinner, we had the grilled mushrooms, the fried calamari, the salad with goat cheese, the fish and of course…the famous "secreto pork!" It is an experience that should not be missed when visiting Madrid!

It was only 8 euros from the centre for a short taxi ride and sooooo worth it. Friendly, good value and amazing food. Go!

From the moment we arrived we were made most welcome by the friendly staff, and all spoke good to excellent English. Our waitress guided us through the menu and the specials and patiently advised us on how much food to order( they do 1/2 portions as well, as the full portions are huge!) The barbecued octopus was sensational as well as the kilo of beef(which was not kobe beef, but spanish) which was cooked rare but they cooked it a little more for my partner. The owner picked an unctous Ribero del Douro to go with the beef which was a real steal at €36. The whole bill came to about €118 for two, but we had a mountain of food of the highest quality, served by the nicest and friendliest people. A perfect evening!

title_review: The BEST restaurant in Madrid. Simply phenomenal
review_preview: I speak for both Alcaravea and the sister restaurant Alcaravea Gaztambide in this review, having visited both on numerous occasions during my 6 months in Madrid. I only have great things to say about this place... not ONE negative comment to makeI stumbled upon...
review_full: I speak for both Alcaravea and the sister restaurant Alcaravea Gaztambide in this review, having visited both on numerous occasions during my 6 months in Madrid. I only have great things to say about this place... not ONE negative comment to make I stumbled upon this restaurant thanks to TripAdvisor as it happens. At the time it was in the top three places to eat in Madrid - it still should be! - and as I lived in the center it wasn't difficult to get to.  While the first time we went was on a weekday early evening, so we were able to walk right in, friday to sunday dinners I would suggest booking in advance. Even during subsequent visits, when there were only two of us and we hadn't booked, the warm and welcoming staff were happy to make space even if it meant shifting a few tables.  The first thing I noticed about this place when walking in was the mouthwatering aroma of beautifully cooked Spanish food lingering in the air. In both restaurants the owner would personally seat us, keep conversation flowing throughout the dining experience and always be available for advice and recommendations. The staff all spoke perfect English, and even the owner of the Gaztambide branch who wasn't quite as fluent, would make jokes in Spanglish and recognize me everytime I came back.  Not only is this place perfectly romantic for couples, I went twice with family (just 2-3 of us) and another few times with a massive group of friends, which didn't make the service and food any less personable and punctual. I insisted some of my Spanish friends should book it for their birthdays, and they all raved about it and congratulated me on the fantastic find, all wishing that they had discovered the place years ago in their own hometown. Even my foodie friend whose parents own a restaurant took her family here and they were just bowled over. Which seems to be the general reaction. As for the food, be it recommendations from the staff, or the complimentary 'amuse-bouche' that came with every meal (from many types of warm fresh bread and cheeses, to tangy shots of gazpacho) or the array of amazing desserts (and I learnt that Spain weren't the best at cakes and desserts, perhaps it's their flour.... but this place changed that perception in seconds) It was all absolutely breathtaking. If I didnt have favourites that I would continually choose, I would have loved to get through the entire menu. ahhh the favourites (see pictures)... MUST ORDER:  -Kilo of Kobe Beef Now i'm not a steak/beef/burger fan whatsoever. It's always been too chewy for me, or lacking flavour. So when (only thanks to a recommendation by the staff) we ordered a kilo of Kobe beef, rare and still moo-ing on the plate (at a ridiculously cheap price of £30) which came with potatoes and green peppers, i was a little apprehensive. It was the most succulent, melt-in-the-mouth, delicious meat I had ever tasted. And the portion was so huge, but too delectable to waste. This dish alone is a reason for anyone to come here. -Croquettas (especially the goats cheese and honey) Delicate, perfectly crispy on the outside and silky smooth on the inside. Possibly the best croquettas I've tasted... and I've had a fair few in my day -Calamari Commonly overcooked, chewy and bland. Not this time! Perfection -Desserts Because you couldn't possibly choose as everyone of the desserts are heavenly. But the Tiramisu inside a toblerone is a stroke of genius!!! Even though we were bursting at the seams from all the food, we HAD to have some of this. We ended up waddling home, our bellies pregnant with the tastiest meal I'd eaten in a very long time. But the real icing on the cake was the bill at the end. For such attentive, creative fine-dining the price was extremely reasonable, making Alcaravea free from that 'fine-dining' pretentious nature.  Honest, humble food made with heart and passion. No wonder Spain has been a contender for the best restaurants in the world this past decade. I implore you.... don't miss out.

review_preview: Not really my type of food but I was blown away by this restaurant and wish hadn't booked elsewhere for the remainder of our trip as otherwise could have eaten here everyday. The service was exceptional, we were lucky enough to be served by César...
review_full: Not really my type of food but I was blown away by this restaurant and wish hadn't booked elsewhere for the remainder of our trip as otherwise could have eaten here everyday. The service was exceptional, we were lucky enough to be served by César the owner I think. His English is excellent and he explained the various dishes (suggesting we share) in great detail and passion. Told us what had come in that day. He also guided us through the menu towards what would suit us the best. So the food?! Truly exceptional. I loved everything. The squid. Pork scratchings (don't be put off by the description) and pork isn't my favourite meat. I could go on but I'm already salivating just thinking of it again. Oh and the cheeses. Superb. Also I'm told all the wines just have a10€ mark up so not paying over the top for a decent bottle of wine. And the bill? Unbelievably modest bearing in mind we stuffed ourselves. So don't visit once, move in! Totally won over. Now my type of food!

review_full: We've been lucky enough to travel all over the world but this is the first time I've felt compelled to share my thoughts on a restaurant but wow Alcaravea is wonderful! We visited on a dull Monday evening in January but the atmosphere was great and they were almost full. Ceasar (if i recall correctly) is the owner and a fantastic host. We have some Spanish and like to try but his English was excellent. Rather than order from the menu he asked us what we liked and we left it to him and couldn't have choosen better! Amazing pork cheek stew that melted in the mouth and a new cut of pork we don't use in the UK but so tasty. Also variations of black pudding but that's just our taste! We can't recommend this place enough, it is literally the best restaurant we've ever been to! Go there, you not regret it!

review_preview: In Madrid, with all its restaurants, anything in the Trip Advisor top 300 is going to be worth a visit. This place is a must.Arrived without a reservation on a Saturday night, but César, the manager, squeezed us in and treated us like old...
review_full: In Madrid, with all its restaurants, anything in the Trip Advisor top 300 is going to be worth a visit. This place is a must. Arrived without a reservation on a Saturday night, but César, the manager, squeezed us in and treated us like old friends. With some excellent advice (and some warnings about portion size), this most magnificent of hosts got us on our way to what was to be one of the best meals we've had in ages, and definitely the best in our four nights in the city. The pork fillet was incredible, the asparagus and black pudding supreme. The wine list, too, is a treat: extensive and as reasonably priced as the food. In addition to the delicious food and wine, the service was top-notch, made more impressive still by the fact that this place also boasts a lively bar area where the drinks are served with the same glowing style as the restaurant. It was a marvellous night, topped off brilliantly with the geniality and efficiency of the rugby and music-loving César, who even took the time to suggest a bar to go on to, if we were looking for a late drink...which of course we were, this is Madrid!
