review_preview: This is a good choice if you like good food in a fun atmosphere at a good price right in the city centre - its in a side street by Sol. The food is in huge quantities (don't order too much) - we went twice...
review_full: This is a good choice if you like good food in a fun atmosphere at a good price right in the city centre - its in a side street by Sol. The food is in huge quantities (don't order too much) - we went twice and everything that we had was good quality. The place has more locals than tourists especially at lunch time - seems to cater for all age groups too. It has a busy almost manic atmosphere with the waiters rushing round between tables but everything we ordered arrived quickly and with no errors. The Rioja is excellent too. Decor is authentic - certainly not plush - but suits the atmosphere well. And if you want a good lunchtime deal - we paid 10 euros each for two people and got three big courses each for that with plenty of choice. Included a free drink - we chose a glass of wine each and they just gave us the full bottle! Enjoy!

title_review: A real local "find" in a town of great restaurants, excellent food & service!
review_preview: Loved our meal here...and a week later, I'm still salivating over the thought of the food we enjoyed here. We cabbed to this local neighborhood to this small storefront, questioning each other "Is this it? Are we in the right place?" and were greeted warmly...
review_full: Loved our meal here...and a week later, I'm still salivating over the thought of the food we enjoyed here. We cabbed to this local neighborhood to this small storefront, questioning each other "Is this it? Are we in the right place?" and were greeted warmly by the Owner who also waited on us and checked in with us regularly to insure everything was to our liking. We went with his recommendation for an appetizer consisting of 5 (x 2, one for each of us) very interesting tapas, all scrumptious. For our mains, we ordered the Secreto Iberian Pork w/Parmesian - that was perhaps my favorite entree of our entire trip, so rich and tender, with just the right amount of sea salt, and an order of a medley of mushrooms. So many things sounded great on the menu but he held us back from ordering more - and we were so stuffed, we couldn't even order a dessert (tho we declared earlier that we were "definitely" going to indulge in one)! Add in a reasonable bottle of wine and for $100US, we were "fat and <oh-so> happy" heading home. We would absolutely return to this wonderful "find" to partake alongside the locals. Here's an Owner doing all the right things, deserving high marks for food and presentation, and service. Ummm!

review_preview: Thanks, Trip Advisor contributors for this excellent recommendation!  This is a warm, cozy restaurant frequented by locals.  As others have written, the owner and servers are generous with their suggestions (they speak English well) and considerately do keep you from over-ordering. It was a bit...
review_full: Thanks, Trip Advisor contributors for this excellent recommendation! This is a warm, cozy restaurant frequented by locals. As others have written, the owner and servers are generous with their suggestions (they speak English well) and considerately do keep you from over-ordering. It was a bit different for us to get used to the "Tapas" concept, but it worked out fine. I can say that we had the BEST Jamon Iberico we have ever eaten in our lives and there are no words to describe the tender, sumptuous flavor of the "Secreto Iberico Pork" (it's a cut from the side, along the ribs, made with rock salt and served with potatoes) we ate! This dish is a MUST! We also shared the calamari in black ink rice that was unbelievably delicious. A much ordered dish (and a perfect accompaniament to the food) was the medly of mushrooms we couldn't get enough of! We were too embarrassed to return a second night in a row, but when we arrived back in Madrid 7 days later, that is where we headed again to eat the same things, as we knew from eating all over Spain on our trip, we would never have a meal of this caliber again! (we ate at the Av. Bermudez location)

Good selection, good food and large portions. Our friends couldn't believe it all came included in the price. Rustic little place with a lively atmosphere. Not the place to go for if you're looking for a classy, Michelin star type of place, but fabulous for lunch or a night out with friends.

title_review: Friendly service, great flavours, reasonably priced
review_preview: We recently went for dinner at Alcaravea on Calle Bermudez to celebrate my birthday. From the moment we entered there was a great atmosphere, first in the busy bar, and then in the restaurant itself where our host went out of his way to make...
review_full: We recently went for dinner at Alcaravea on Calle Bermudez to celebrate my birthday. From the moment we entered there was a great atmosphere, first in the busy bar, and then in the restaurant itself where our host went out of his way to make us feel at home. He personally talked us through what was on offer that day and it was refreshing not to have to trawl through a standard menu. The tomato and buratta salad started (mozarella-like local cheese that melts in the mouth) was sublime and could easily have fed four people. We then enjoyed battered white asparagus before the mains of mullet and sirloin steak. I would recommend Alcaravea to anyone looking for a special meal in authentic surroundings without the pretentious atmosphere of more expensive (and ultimately inferior) establishments.

review_preview: Notwithstanding many good reviews on TripAdvisor, the restaurant was filled with locals during my visit.  Waiter Cesar, who speaks English well, suggested that I have a mullet fish prepared in the Spanish way.  This incredible dish included two filets (left and right sides of the...
review_full: Notwithstanding many good reviews on TripAdvisor, the restaurant was filled with locals during my visit. Waiter Cesar, who speaks English well, suggested that I have a mullet fish prepared in the Spanish way. This incredible dish included two filets (left and right sides of the mullet) in a wonderful, spicy sauce, and the skelaton of the fish deep-fried to a wonderful crispness that allows one to eat it, minus the head, like a cracker. Not only was this dish delicious, it was also quite a sight.  As with many Madrid restaurants, things are quiet before 9 at night. The dinner crew didn´t fully arrive until that time.  Note that there are three versions of this restaurant, all under the same ownership and with the same menu. Two are located within a couple of blocks of each other, the third at a distance. I went to the original restaurant, whose address shows up first on the web site. I assume that the others are equally good.

title_review: Great atmosphere, fantastic service, very good food, reasonably priced
review_preview: We were here in the afternoon and the atmosphere was great - kind of local and somehow elegant and relaxed at the same time. The service was excellent - our waiter spoke English very well, he was very helpful, attentive, and infinitely patient. Other staff...
review_full: We were here in the afternoon and the atmosphere was great - kind of local and somehow elegant and relaxed at the same time.  The service was excellent - our waiter spoke English very well, he was very helpful, attentive, and infinitely patient. Other staff members were also nice. We received rolls and a plate of tapas before we ordered. One of our group is a vegetarian and one eats only fish, and we found several non-meat/non-shell-dwelling options on the menu (which is not always easy in Spain). Three of us ordered the specials, which included first and main courses, and dessert or coffee. All of the first-course portions that our group chose were large enough to be the main course. Two of our dishes came with little peppers that the waiter called pimentos. They were amazing! I'd go back there just for those little peppers!  The sangria was one of the best I've had. It actually had alcohol in it and didn't taste like Kool-aid. We each had a different desert and shared. I wasn't crazy about the chocolate cake, but the flan was ok and the cheesecake was good. The price was good for such a big meal: 12 Euros per special including dessert. (Drinks separate, also decently priced.)

title_review: Great way to end a trip to Spain
review_preview: Though service in Spain (especially Madrid) is professional though not overly solicitous, we ended our tour of Barcelona and Madrid at this watering hole only a five-minute walk from the exquisite ME Reina Victoria hotel, and we could not have been more pleased. The food...
review_full: Though service in Spain (especially Madrid) is professional though not overly solicitous, we ended our tour of Barcelona and Madrid at this watering hole only a five-minute walk from the exquisite ME Reina Victoria hotel, and we could not have been more pleased. The food was tasty, plentiful and priced fairly (we shared a special of parrillada mixta de carne -- a mixed grill) as well as patatas bravas with two sauces, and a couple glasses of the house red.  While the food was probably just a bit above average in quality, the service was the most friendly and helpful we experienced in our trip. (Our waiter talked us out of another tapas order, fearing we wouldn't be able to finish our meal. We were grateful for the assistance as, the night previously, we ended up wasting most of the sumptuous serving of paella at the nearby Naturbier tavern because my remedial Spanish and inexperience ordering tapas led us to gorge on raciones, leaving us ill-prepared to tackle the paella, which was the best of three I had in Spain. Regrets.) Atmosphere: an unpretentious neighborhood saloon (though not a punch-your-way-out type of bar by any stretch) with some interesting decor on the walls that America's flair-heavy chains could only hope to replicate). A raucous though convivial union meeting of, I believe, medical services employees occurred downstairs, which added a beer hall-like frisson to the night that we appreciated.  Cuisine was fine, but by no means the best of our stay, but the restaurant experience at El Buscon topped them all. It's good we didn't find this place until our last night: otherwise, we might not have ventured past its doors for the few nights we were wannabe Madrilenos.

review_preview: Went here on a Sunday evening for dinner. Shown to a downstairs table & drinks order promptly taken. Had the wild mushrooms, mixed meat platter & patatas bravas which were lovely. We were actually stopped by the waiter from ordering anything else, as the amount...
review_full: Went here on a Sunday evening for dinner. Shown to a downstairs table & drinks order promptly taken. Had the wild mushrooms, mixed meat platter & patatas bravas which were lovely. We were actually stopped by the waiter from ordering anything else, as the amount of food we ordered was enough for both of us to share.  Atmosphere was great & were given 4 free shots at the end of the meal. Another nice thing was my husband was given the bottle of wine after having ordered just a glass at no extra charge.  Be warned, the shots are massive & far larger than the English size measures you get!  Very reasonable price, total bill came to 39 euros for both of us including drinks.

title_review: Not a mexican dish in sight!
review_preview: Not sure how this restaurant is connected to the Mexican cuisine, which is why we went to a lot of trouble to hunt it down. Even the waiter we spoke to was surprised! It is totally Spanish cuisine, however, we were not disappointed when we...
review_full: Not sure how this restaurant is connected to the Mexican cuisine, which is why we went to a lot of trouble to hunt it down. Even the waiter we spoke to was surprised! It is totally Spanish cuisine, however, we were not disappointed when we decided to stay for a meal anyway. I had the the Spanish version of T bone steak, which I thought was excellent and a huge sized meal - this came with tasty potatoes and grilled green pimientos. My wife had the garlic chicken with a mixed salad. The food was flavoursome and in good sized portions. We thought this was a good priced restaurant as we paid 46 euros for this and had 1 beer and several glasses of house wine (red and white). I recommend this restaurant for fresh home cooked local food but not if you are looking for Mexican food!

review_preview: Stopped by for tapas and this was a real treat. However, initially we almost left as the waiter walked across and literally threw the menus & settings at our table . However, it was worth persevering as the service improved and the food was of...
review_full: Stopped by for tapas and this was a real treat. However, initially we almost left as the waiter walked across and literally threw the menus & settings at our table . However, it was worth persevering as the service improved and the food was of top quality.  Firstly, the complimentary jamon and cheese were of excellent quality. We then had: Tortilla espanola which was the best we tasted in Madrid, perfectly cooked Grilled aubergine which was delicious once dressed with their high quality olive oil Rabo de toro - a real feast and absolutely divine. The star dish! Patatas bravas - again simple but the best we had in Madrid.  The tapas and racciones are displayed on large boards outside the restaurant and there is no indication of size or cost so be careful to check that you aren't ordering too much.

review_preview: A place where locals talk, drink and eat. Whoever want to eat amazing Spanish food in local and warn atmosphere must go in Cantina La Traviesa.You can feel how servants enjoy their work and that the first thing that they care about is  -...
review_full: A place where locals talk, drink and eat. Whoever want to eat amazing Spanish food in local and warn atmosphere must go in Cantina La Traviesa. You can feel how servants enjoy their work and that the first thing that they care about is - food. Just like it has to be in good restaurant, and the rest is coming with that. After my wife and I ate delicious mixed paella, next day we brought our friends with us and we all tried other delicious meals. Everything was excellent. Even our communication with very friendly waiter based on very few English words was jokingly. Red vine of the house was also very good.  If I could stay in Madrid few more days I would still take my dinners there.

title_review: Amazing food in old world Spanish restaurant
review_preview: If you're looking for authentic Spanish food, this is the place to go.  It's a very old restaurant that is frequented by locals and in the heart of Madrid. Most of the waiters don't speak that much English but all were very friendly.  The paella...
review_full: If you're looking for authentic Spanish food, this is the place to go. It's a very old restaurant that is frequented by locals and in the heart of Madrid. Most of the waiters don't speak that much English but all were very friendly. The paella is fabulous and you have to try the scallops in their real shells. Of course, the iberico ham is amazing as well. If you want water with your meal, just ask for carafe de agua and you'll get Madrid tap water which is excellent. No need to pay high prices for bottled water.

review_preview: I booked a table at Alcaravea after reading the reviews on here and we were the first to turn up for dinner at 8;15pm on a Saturday (we were told that in general people with young children or the elderly eat at 9pm and people...
review_full: I booked a table at Alcaravea after reading the reviews on here and we were the first to turn up for dinner at 8;15pm on a Saturday (we were told that in general people with young children or the elderly eat at 9pm and people of our age normally eat at around 11pm!) Cesar was great and explained all the specials and even gave us a mini olive oil tasting session and recommended the wine. We went for the Spanish omelette with mushrooms and the fresh cod grilled with aioli- both were amazing, the portions were huge and we ended up taking half the omelette away with us. Several people had turned up without reservations and were squeezed in, but the restaurant filled up pretty quickly. The total bill was around 50 Euros with two mains, a dessert and 3 glasses of wine, and my boyfriend and I both agreed that this was our best meal in Madrid!
